Description: Much of bowl of North Ionian pottery standed plate with upturned rim, mended from six fragments; slipped white in and out; interior, from outside: band with added red line at rim; hook maeander frieze; frieze of alternating upright and pendent palmettes with dot rosette fill, between bands with added red bands lined in white; in tondo, alternating leaves and lozenges; red on alternating palmette leaves and on leaves in tondo. Exterior: five bands; top of stem, just presereved, glazed.
Bibliographic references: Rawson 1984 / Chinese Ornament: The Lotus and the Dragon (fig. 192a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.452)
